007package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
008
009import imagingbook.violajones.data.HaarTrainingSet;
010import org.w3c.dom.Document;
011import org.w3c.dom.Element;
012import org.w3c.dom.Node;
013import org.w3c.dom.NodeList;
014import org.xml.sax.SAXException;
015
016import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder;
017import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory;
018import javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException;
019import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.io.InputStream;
022import java.io.PrintStream;
023import java.util.LinkedList;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Scanner;
026
027/**
028 * This class represents a trained Haar cascade classifier. Training results were obtained from OpenCV's
029 * 'opencv_haartraining' application (now obsolete, see http://docs.opencv.org/doc/user_guide/ug_traincascade.html),
030 * available as XML files. Currently only the old-type XML format is supported.
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/04/15
034 */
035public class HaarCascadeDescriptor {
036        // TODO: Write a reader for the newer format (produced by 'opencv_traincascade').
037        public static final String XML_TYPE_ID1 = "opencv-haar-classifier";             // OpenCV "old style"
038        public static final String XML_TYPE_ID2 = "opencv-cascade-classifier";          // OpenCV new style?
039        
040        private int width = 0;
041        private int height = 0;
042        private List<Stage> stages = null;
043        
044        // --- constructors ------------------------------
045        
046        private HaarCascadeDescriptor() {       
047        }
048        
049        // --- static factory methods -------------------
050        
051        /**
052         * Creates a Haar cascade from the specification given in a
053         * XML stream.
054         * 
055         * @param strm input stream providing XML content
056         * @return a new Haar cascade object
057         */
058        public static HaarCascadeDescriptor fromInputStream(InputStream strm) {
059                //HaarCascadeDescriptor hcd = null;
060                DocumentBuilderFactory factory = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
061                Document xmlDoc = null;
062                try {
063                        DocumentBuilder builder = factory.newDocumentBuilder();
064                        xmlDoc = builder.parse(strm);
065                } catch (SAXException | IOException | ParserConfigurationException e) {
066                        throw new RuntimeException(HaarCascadeDescriptor.class.getSimpleName() +
067                                        ": could not create descriptor from XML stream");
068                }
069                return fromXmlDocument(xmlDoc);
070        }
071        
072        public static HaarCascadeDescriptor fromXmlDocument(Document xmlDoc) {
073                HaarCascadeDescriptor hcd = new HaarCascadeDescriptor();
074                hcd.buildFromXmlDoc(xmlDoc);
075                return hcd;
076        }
077
078        // --- getters and setters ------------------------
079        
080        /**
081         * Returns the width of this Haar cascade.
082         * @return the width of this Haar cascade (in pixels units).
083         */
084        public int getWidth() {
085                return width;
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Returns the height of this Haar cascade.
090         * @return the height of this Haar cascade (in pixels units).
091         */
092        public int getHeight() {
093                return height;
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Returns the number of stages in this Haar cascade.
098         * @return the number of stages this Haar cascade.
099         */
100        public List<Stage> getStages() {
101                return stages;
102        }
103
104        // ------------------------------------------------
105        
106        /**
107         * The detector consists of stages, each of them telling whether
108         * the considered zone represents the object with probability a bit
109         * greater than 0.5. If a zone passes all stages, it is considered as
110         * representing the object.
111         * 
112         * @param xmlDoc the XML document object
113         * @throws Exception
114         */
115        private void buildFromXmlDoc(Document xmlDoc) {
116                Element root = getFirstChildElement(xmlDoc.getDocumentElement());
117                //System.out.println("Root node name = " + root.getNodeName());
118                
119                //TODO: different readers may be needed for other OpenCV training files
120                String type_id = root.getAttribute("type_id");
121                if (!type_id.equals(XML_TYPE_ID1)) {
122                        throw new RuntimeException("XML file of type " + XML_TYPE_ID1 + " expected.");
123                }
124                
125                /* Read the size (in pixels) of the detector. */
126                Scanner scanner = new Scanner(getChildElement(root, "size").getTextContent()); //new2
127                width = scanner.nextInt();
128                height = scanner.nextInt();
129                scanner.close();
130                
131                stages = new LinkedList<Stage>();
132
133                
134                /* Iterate over the stages nodes to read the stages. */
135                Element stagesE = getChildElement(root, "stages");
136                for (Element stageElem : getChildElements(stagesE, "_")) {
137                        // read the stage threshold:
138                        double stageThreshold = Float.parseFloat(getChildElement(stageElem, "stage_threshold").getTextContent());
139                        Stage stage = new Stage(stageThreshold);
140                        
141                        // read all trees of this stage:
142                        Element treesE = getChildElement(stageElem, "trees");
143                        for (Element treeElem : getChildElements(treesE, "_")) {
144                                
145                                // collect the features contained in this tree:
146                                List<FeatureNode> nodes = new LinkedList<>();
147                                for (Element featureElem : getChildElements(treeElem, "_")) {
148                                        double featureThreshold = Double.parseDouble(getChildElement(featureElem, "threshold").getTextContent());
149                                        
150                                        // get the LEFT value OR child (one of them is empty)
151                                        int childL = FeatureNode.NO_CHILD;
152                                        double valL = FeatureNode.NO_VALUE;
153                                        Element el = getChildElement(featureElem, "left_val");
154                                        if (el != null) {
155                                                valL = Double.parseDouble(el.getTextContent());
156                                        } else {
157                                                childL = Integer.parseInt(getChildElement(featureElem, "left_node").getTextContent());
158                                        }
159
160                                        // get the RIGHT value OR child (one of them is empty)
161                                        int childR = FeatureNode.NO_CHILD;
162                                        double valR = FeatureNode.NO_VALUE;
163                                        Element er = getChildElement(featureElem, "right_val");
164                                        if (er != null) {
165                                                valR = Double.parseDouble(er.getTextContent());
166                                        } else {
167                                                childR = Integer.parseInt(getChildElement(featureElem, "right_node").getTextContent());
168                                        }
169                                        
170                                        List<FeaturePatch> patches = new LinkedList<FeaturePatch>();
171                                        
172                                        // read rectangles of this feature and add:
173                                        Element rectsE = getChildElement(getChildElement(featureElem, "feature"), "rects");
174                                        for (Element rectElem : getChildElements(rectsE, "_")) {
175                                                String s = rectElem.getTextContent().trim();
176                                                FeaturePatch r = FeaturePatch.fromString(s);
177                                                patches.add(r);
178                                        }
179                                        
180                                        FeatureNode feature = new FeatureNode(width, height, featureThreshold, valL, childL, valR, childR, 
181                                                                                                                patches.toArray(new FeaturePatch[0]));
182                                        nodes.add(feature);
183                                }
184                                
185                                FeatureTree tree = new FeatureTree(nodes.toArray(new FeatureNode[0]));
186                                stage.addTree(tree);
187                        }
188                        stages.add(stage);
189                }
190        }
191        
192        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
193        
194        /**
195         * Returns the first child node that is of type {@link Element}.
196         * @param parent the parent node
197         * @return the first child node of type {@link Element}.
198         */
199        private Element getFirstChildElement(Node parent) {
200                Node child = parent.getFirstChild();
201                while (!(child instanceof Element)) {
202                        child = child.getNextSibling();
203                }
204                return (Element) child;
205        }
206        
207        /**
208         * Collects all child elements into a list.
209         * @param parent the parent node
210         * @return a list of child elements, which may be empty
211         */
212        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
213        private List<Element> getChildElements(Node parent) {
214                List<Element> elements = new LinkedList<>();
215                NodeList children = parent.getChildNodes();
216                for (int i = 0; i < children.getLength(); i++) {
217                        Node child = children.item(i);
218                        if (child instanceof Element) {
219                                elements.add((Element) child);
220                        }
221                }
222                return elements;
223        }
224        
225        /**
226         * Collects all child elements with the given name into a list.
227         * @param parent the parent node
228         * @param name the name of the child element
229         * @return a list of child elements, which may be empty
230         */
231        private List<Element> getChildElements(Node parent, String name) {
232                List<Element> elements = new LinkedList<>();
233                NodeList children = parent.getChildNodes();
234                for (int i = 0; i < children.getLength(); i++) {
235                        Node child = children.item(i);
236                        if (child instanceof Element && name.equals(child.getNodeName())) {
237                                elements.add((Element) child);
238                        }
239                }
240                return elements;
241        }
242
243        /**
244         * Searches for the first immediate child element with the given name.
245         * @param parent the parent node
246         * @param name the name of the child element
247         * @return the first matching child element or {@code null} if none exists.
248         */
249        private Element getChildElement(Node parent, String name) {
250                for (Node child = parent.getFirstChild(); child != null; child = child.getNextSibling()) {
251                        if (child instanceof Element && name.equals(child.getNodeName()))
252                                return (Element) child;
253                }
254                return null;
255        }
256        
257        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
258        
259        @Override
260        public String toString() {
261                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
262                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
263                printToStream(strm);
264                return bas.toString();
265        }
266        
267        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
268                strm.println("Listing of " + this.getClass().getSimpleName());
269                strm.format("Size = %d x %d\n", width, height);
270                strm.format("Number of stages = %d\n", stages.size());
271                int scnt = 0;
272                for (Stage stage : stages) {
273                        scnt++;
274                        strm.format("******* Stage %d *********\n", scnt);
275                        stage.print();
276                }
277        }
278        
279        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
280        
281        public static void main(String[] args) {
282                for (HaarTrainingSet hts : HaarTrainingSet.values()) {
283                        System.out.println("*****  Resource = " + hts.toString() + " *********");
284                        HaarCascadeDescriptor hcd = HaarCascadeDescriptor.fromInputStream(hts.getStream());
285                        hcd.printToStream(System.out);
286                        System.out.println();
287                }
288                
289                System.out.println("done.");
290        }
291        
292
293}
